definition: to reject/to refuse to take a call
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: Always warn myself. The person's success can't measure with the money.
sentences.chinese: 將這幾個號嗎設爲來電拒接就可以了。

sentences.english: It is one of the best ways to creep someone out.
sentences.chinese: 這是代表一個拒接別人的好方法。

sentences.english: By not answering our landlines, we bring a little of that ruthlessness into our home lives.
sentences.chinese: 拒接電話給我們的家庭生活帶入了一絲冷酷的色彩。

sentences.english: Therefore, he refuses to look at dominant consumption.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他拒接觀察主流消費。

sentences.english: I don't think she will this question.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲她不會拒接回答這個問題。

sentences.english: So when you call I'm pressin' seven (it's over), don't wanna hear your messages (messages) (this time).
sentences.chinese: 所以拒接你的來電，只是不想聽到你的留言。

sentences.english: He turned down my suggestion without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 他毫不猶豫地拒接了我的建議。

definition: to add sb to one's blacklist (on a cellphone, or in instant messaging software etc)/abbr. for 拉到黑名單|拉到黑名单

incoming telegram or telephone call/your telegram, telephone call, or message/to send a telegram or make a telephone call here (i.e. to the speaker)/to have instant attraction to sb/to have chemistry with sb/to come back (of electricity, after an outage)
to turn off (a machine or device)/to finish shooting a film
